abstract.t: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) provides a framework for passing configuration information to hosts on a TCP/IP network. DHCP is based on the Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP), adding the capability of automatic allocation of reusable network addresses and additional configuration options. DHCP captures the behavior of BOOTP relay agents, [23], and DHCP participants can interoperate with BOOTP participants. Due to some errors introduced into RFC 1531 in the editorial process, this memo is reissued as RFC 1541.
